sad, Tim?" Tim said, "I have a flat tire and can't play with my friends." The bird wanted to help Tim. She flew away and came back with a new tire.
Tim was so happy! He thanked the bird and they changed the tire together. With the new tire, Tim could play with his friends again. He was not gloomy anymore.
The moral of the story is that when we ask for help, our friends can make us feel better. It is always good to ask for help when we need it.

It was a large brown bear! Eva was very scared and wanted to run away. But the bear didn't look scary – it was eating some yummy honey from a tree. Eva was brave and slowly walked up to the bear to say hello.
The bear was very friendly, and after a while, it went to sleep. Eva decided to stay and have a nap too. While she napped, the bear watched over her. It was the best nap ever!

young prince who didn't feel well. He had a sick heart, and he couldn't make it heal. He was very sad.
So the prince went on a quest to find something to make him feel better. He asked every shopkeeper he met, but no one could help him.

Once upon a time there was a crab. He was walking slowly across the sand. The sun was setting and it made the sand glow. The crab watched and said “Wow!”

and his heart raced. But then, Tim tripped on a rock and fell down. He felt a bitter pain in his knee and started to weep. His friends stopped running to help him, but Tim wanted to finish the race.
Tim got up and started running again, even though his knee hurt. He ran and ran, and finally, he crossed the finish line. His friends cheered for him, and Tim felt a great victory. He was happy that he didn't give up, and his friends were proud of him too.

, "No, Lily! That's my vine!" Lily felt sad and asked, "Can we share the vine, please?" Tim thought about it and said, "Okay, we can share."
Lily and Tim took turns playing with the mysterious vine. They skipped around the tree, laughing and having fun. They learned that sharing can make everyone happy. And the mysterious vine became their favorite thing to play with at the park.

Lily and Max are twins. They like to walk with Mom and Dad in the morning. They see many things on the way. They see birds, flowers, cars,

rocks. They were having fun.
But then the sky became dark and grey. Lily and Max heard a loud sound. It was thunder. They saw a flash of light. It was lightning. They felt some drops of water. It was rain.
"Let's go inside!" Lily said. "The rain is wet and cold!"
"Wait!" Max said. "I want to reach the rain!"
Max stretched his arms up to the sky. He tried to catch the rain with his hands. He felt the rain on his fingers and palms. He smiled.
"Why do you want to reach the rain?"

bird stuck in a tree near the stage. The bird was scared and couldn't fly. Lily wanted to save the bird before her dance.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Yesterday, he went to the park with his mom. They played and had lots of fun. But it was a very hot and

animals liked to play there. One day, the stream became dirty and sad. The animals did not want to play there anymore.
A creative little girl named Lily lived in the village. She saw the sad stream and wanted to help. She thought and thought about how to make the stream pretty again. She had a big idea!
Lily worked hard to restore the stream. She picked up all the dirt and put it in a bag. She asked her friends to help, and they did. Soon, the stream was clean and happy again. The animals came back to play, and everyone was happy.

Lucy was happy that the helper dog would take care of her grandma. She knew that her grandma would be okay with the dog's help. And the worried look on her mom's face went away.

One day, the pony fell down and got hurt. The pony was sad and ashamed because it could not play with its friends. It wanted to heal and be happy again.
A kind lady saw the pony and helped it. She put a soft bandage on the pony's leg to help it heal. After a few days, the pony felt better and could play again. The pony was no longer ashamed and was very happy. All the friends were happy too.

car was getting dirty.
Suddenly, Sam tripped on a rock and dropped his toy police car. The car got a big scratch and Sam felt sad. He picked up the car and looked at it closely. He knew it wasn't perfect anymore, but he still loved it.
Sam's mom saw what happened and came over to give him a hug. She told him that even though the toy police car had a scratch, it was still special because it was his favorite. Sam smiled and continued to play with his toy car, knowing that it was still his most-loved toy, even with the scratch.
